alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 27 at 4:54AM PST until December 27 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A potent Pacific storm will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain causing localized flooding as well as rapid rises on area streams and creeks late Monday night through Tuesday. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern California and western California, including the following areas, in northern California, Northern Monterey Bay, San Francisco Peninsula Coast and Santa Cruz Mountains. In western California, San Francisco. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
